summary: An email from an FBI agent to colleagues regarding a press inquiry from a New Yorker Magazine reporter about the Epstein case. The reporter asked the agent to verify that he and another agent traveled to Australia and interviewed a woman who disclosed she had sex with Jeffrey Epstein and Alan Dershowitz.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the press inquiry; a woman interviewed by the FBI disclosed she had sex with him.

persons.name: Allan Dershowitz
persons.context: A woman interviewed by the FBI in Australia disclosed she had sex with him, according to the reporter's inquiry.

persons.name: Jason
persons.context: An FBI agent who, along with the email author, traveled to Australia to conduct an interview related to the Epstein case.

connections.description: Both are named by a woman interviewed by the FBI as individuals she had sex with, according to a press inquiry.
FBI Agent Jason traveled to Australia to interview a woman who made allegations about Epstein.

events.title: FBI Interview in Australia
events.description: FBI agents traveled to Australia and interviewed a woman who disclosed she had sex with Jeffrey Epstein and Alan Dershowitz.

events.title: Press Inquiry from The New Yorker
events.description: A reporter from The New Yorker Magazine contacted an FBI agent on his personal cell to verify details about an FBI interview in Australia related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: An FBI agent received a press inquiry on his personal cell from a New Yorker Magazine reporter about the Epstein case in January 2019.
The reporter sought to verify that FBI agents traveled to Australia to interview a woman who disclosed she had sex with both Jeffrey Epstein and Alan Dershowitz.
The email suggests the FBI was actively investigating allegations involving Epstein and Dershowitz, including interviews conducted internationally.
